case.name: Glasshouse Mountains Gubbi Gubbi People v Registrar Native Title Tribunal [2008] FCA 529 (21 April 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: application for review of a decision by the native title registrar not to register an application
no breach of procedural fairness based on a failure of the delegate to follow an earlier registration decision
consideration of the principles expressed in yorta yorta
factual basis for claimed native title
szbel v minister for immigration and multicultural and indigenous affairs immigration
appellant claimed he feared persecution on basis of his conversion to christianity if returned to iran
delegate of the first respondent refused to grant appellant protection visa because not satisfied of the genuineness of appellant's conversion to christianity
appellant invited by tribunal to give evidence relating to the issues arising in relation to the decision under review
appellant gave evidence addressed to the delegate's concern regarding the genuineness of his conversion to christianity
tribunal affirmed the delegate's decision not to grant a protection visa on the basis that appellant's claims were not credible
whether tribunal failed to notify the appellant adequately of the issues to which its reasoning processes were directed
whether failure of tribunal to ask the appellant to address issues that it considered might be important amounted to a denial of procedural fairness.
whether court has authority to direct the registrar to make a back-dated entry on the register
notification of future acts and ability to negotiation
nature and contents of application for determination of native title
what powers, duties or functions are reposed in the registrar? administrative law
is the acceptance of an application for determination of native title a reviewable decision under the administrative decisions judicial review act? judiciary act s39b
is the registrar of the native title tribunal an officer of the commonwealth?
decision of administrative character made under enactment
conduct engaged in for purpose of making decision
administrative decisions (judicial review) act 1977 (cth), ss. 3 , 5 , 6 . broadcasting and television
power to suspend or revoke licence if satisfied that licensee no longer fit and proper person to hold licence
controller of licensee not fit and proper person
conduct before commencement of licence period
standing as australian citizen of infant daughter of aliens
application for extension of time for compliance with requirements of bankruptcy notice
applicant having filed with registrar an application to set aside notice
act expressly conferring power to extend time; but not to set aside the notice itself
ubi aliquid conceditur, conceditur etiam et id sine quo res ipsa non esse potest
inherent jurisdiction to set aside bankruptcy notice
exercise of discretion to grant extension of time. bankruptcy act 1966 (cth.) ss. 30 , 33 , 41 (6a), (6b) and (6c) bankruptcy amendment act 1980 (cth.) bankruptcy
application for extension of time for compliance with requirement of bankruptcy notice
applicant having filed with registrar an application to set aside notice
act expressly conferring power to extend time but not to set aside notice itself
relation between pars. (a) and (b) of bankruptcy act s. 41 (6a)
exercise of discretion to grant extension of time

bankruptcy amendment act 1980 (cth), ss. 20 , 24 . section 41 (6a) of the bankruptcy act , as amended, provides that: "where, before the expiration of the time fixed by the court or the registrar for compliance with the requirements of a bankruptcy notice

(a) proceedings to set aside the judgment or order in respect of which the bankruptcy notice was issued have been instituted by the debtor; or (b) an application to set aside the bankruptcy notice has been filed with the registrar; the court may, subject to sub-section (6c), extend the time for compliance with the bankruptcy notice."
employee in course of employment doing something lawful apart from provisions of act
